sentence: Technology stocks continued to trend lower this afternoon, with shares of tech companies in the S&P 500 sinking about 0.8%.
In company news, Twitter ( TWTR ) was set to finish the week with a large gain Friday following reports Alphabet ( GOOGL ) and Salesforce ( CRM ) are considering bids for the micro-blogging company.
Citing unnamed sources, Re-code said Twitter is seeking a deal worth at least $30 billion.
The Financial Times also was reporting the company has hired Goldman Sachs to assist with efforts to identify a potential buyer.
TWTR shares were up more than 22% at $22.77 each just before the closing bell, previously topping out today at $22.89 a share.
(+) IMPV, Reportedly considering separate buyout proposals from Cisco ( CSCO ) and Forcepoint - a joint venture between Raytheon ( RTN ) and Vista Equity Partners - according to Bloomberg.
(-) ENPH, Announces plans to idle 11% of global workforce as part of a company-wide restructuring expected to save about $20 mln yearly.
